title: Largest Arable Land Area
description: In 2021, the United States had 157,736,800 hectares of arable land, making it one of the largest in the world.

title: Top Provider of Net ODA to Least Developed Countries
description: In 2022, the United States provided $11,689,380,000 in net official development assistance to the least developed countries, showcasing its commitment to global aid.

title: Leading Global Provider of Net ODA
description: The United States provided a total of $60,328,680,000 in net official development assistance in 2022, the highest in the world.

title: High Taxation on Income, Profits, and Capital Gains
description: In 2023, taxes on income, profits, and capital gains accounted for 92.91% of total taxes in the United States, indicating a heavy reliance on these sources.

title: Extensive Rail Network
description: With a total of 148,553 route-km in 2021, the United States boasts one of the most extensive rail networks globally.

title: Most Secure Internet Servers
description: In 2023, the United States had 62,879,335 secure internet servers, leading the world in digital security infrastructure.

title: Significant Investment in Education
description: The United States invested $1,046,599,480,744 in education in 2021, highlighting its focus on educational development.

title: High Energy Depletion Costs
description: In 2021, the United States faced energy depletion costs amounting to $178,211,930,410, reflecting challenges in sustainable energy use.

title: Substantial Taxes on Products
description: In 2021, taxes less subsidies on products amounted to $829,217,085,000, indicating a significant revenue source for the government.

title: Highest Health Expenditure Per Capita
description: In 2022, the United States spent $12,434 per capita on health, the highest globally, reflecting its investment in healthcare.

title: Significant Trade Deficit
description: In 2023, the United States recorded a trade deficit of $1.06 trillion in goods, highlighting a significant imbalance in trade. This is one of the largest deficits globally.

title: High Net Portfolio Investment Outflow
description: The United States experienced a net portfolio investment outflow of $1.15 trillion in 2023, indicating substantial capital leaving the country.

title: Low Prevalence of Child Wasting
description: As of 2022, only 0.1% of children under 5 in the United States suffer from wasting, one of the lowest rates globally, reflecting good nutritional status.

title: Moderate Prevalence of Anemia in Children
description: In 2019, 6.1% of children aged 6-59 months in the United States were affected by anemia, which is relatively low compared to global standards.

title: Substantial Current Account Deficit
description: The United States had a current account deficit of $905 billion in 2023, indicating more money flowing out than coming in through trade and investment.

title: Low Prevalence of Anemia in Pregnant Women
description: In 2019, 11.5% of pregnant women in the United States were affected by anemia, which is lower than many other countries.

title: High Net Financial Account Outflow
description: The United States recorded a net financial account outflow of $924 billion in 2023, indicating a significant movement of financial resources out of the country.

title: Low Grants and Other Revenue Percentage
description: In 2023, grants and other revenue accounted for only 2.56% of the United States' total revenue, indicating limited reliance on external financial aid.
